tool_description: Explore and retrieve insights into the latest and greatest music charts, artists, and songs worldwide.
name: Billboard Charts API
title: Billboard Charts API

api_list.name: Global Top 200 Songs
api_list.description: Charting the global music landscape, Billboard Global 200 ranks top songs worldwide based on streaming and sales activity across 200+ territories, curated by Luminate.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://billboard-charts-api.p.rapidapi.com/global-200.php"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "billboard-charts-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: TikTok Top 50

api_list.name: Top Artists
api_list.description: Discover the top artists of the week across all genres, ranked by Luminate based on album and track sales, radio airplay audience impressions, and streaming activity data from online sources.

api_list.name: Charts by Category
api_list.description: Retrieve a curated selection of music charts within a specific category using this endpoint. Provide the category ID from "Charts Categories" to explore top charts, global hits, and all-time greats.

api_list.name: Hot 100
api_list.description: Explore the week's top songs across genres on the Hot 100 chart with /hot-100.php, optionally specifying a week using the 'week' query parameter.
api_list.code:

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Charts Categories
api_list.description: Explore diverse music chart categories effortlessly with the Charts Categories API endpoint, delivering a curated selection of top charts, global hits, and the greatest of all time across various genres and themes.

api_list.name: Chart Details by ID
api_list.description: Access detailed chart information, featuring a curated list of songs or artists within a specific category. Utilize the ID from /charts.php and optionally specify a week using the 'week' query parameter (format: YYYY-MM-DD) to explore historical or current chart data. If no week is provided, the returned chart is for the current week.
